CVE-2015-4620	getPORT#	7.8	get_price()	name.c in named in ISC BIND 9.7.x through 9.9.x before 9.9.7-P1 and 9.10.x before 9.10.2-P2
column2: when configured as a recursive resolver with DNSSEC validation
column3: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (REQUIRE assertion failure and daemon exit) by constructing crafted zone data and then making a query for a name in that zone.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-4620

column1: CVE-2014-8500	getPORT#	7.8	get_price()	ISC BIND 9.0.x through 9.8.x
column3: and 9.10.0 through 9.10.1 does not limit delegation chaining
column4: which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption and named crash) via a large or infinite number of referrals.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-8500

column1: CVE-2013-4854	getPORT#	7.8	get_price()	The RFC 5011 implementation in rdata.c in ISC BIND 9.7.x and 9.8.x before 9.8.5-P2
column4: and 9.9.4b1
column6: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and named daemon exit) via a query with a malformed RDATA section that is not properly handled during construction of a log message
column7: as exploited in the wild in July 2013.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-4854

column4: and 9.9.3 before 9.9.3b2 on UNIX platforms allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted regular expression

column4: and 9.7.x before 9.7.6-P2; 9.8.x before 9.8.3-P2; 9.9.x before 9.9.1-P2; and 9.6-ESV before 9.6-ESV-R7-P2

column1: CVE-2017-3141	getPORT#	7.8 HIGH	get_price()	The BIND installer on Windows uses an unquoted service path which can enable a local user to achieve privilege escalation if the host file system permissions allow this. Affects BIND 9.2.6-P2->9.2.9

CVE-2015-8461	getPORT#	7.1	get_price()	Race condition in resolver.c in named in ISC BIND 9.9.8 before 9.9.8-P2 and 9.10.3 before 9.10.3-P2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (INSIST assertion failure and daemon exit) via unspecified vectors.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8461
CVE-2012-5689	getPORT#	7.1	get_price()	ISC BIND 9.8.x through 9.8.4-P1 and 9.9.x through 9.9.2-P1
column2: in certain configurations involving DNS64 with a Response Policy Zone that lacks an AAAA rewrite rule
column3: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and named daemon exit) via a query for an AAAA record.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-5689

column1: CVE-2020-8625	getPORT#	8.1 HIGH	get_price()	BIND servers are vulnerable if they are running an affected version and are configured to use GSS-TSIG features. In a configuration which uses BIND's default settings the vulnerable code path is not exposed
column2: but a server can be rendered vulnerable by explicitly setting valid values for the tkey-gssapi-keytab or tkey-gssapi-credentialconfiguration options. Although the default configuration is not vulnerable
column3: GSS-TSIG is frequently used in networks where BIND is integrated with Samba
column4: as well as in mixed-server environments that combine BIND servers with Active Directory domain controllers. The most likely outcome of a successful exploitation of the vulnerability is a crash of the named process. However
column9: and versions BIND 9.11.3-S1 -> 9.11.27-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.11-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition. Also release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.1 of the BIND 9.17 development branch	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8625

column1: CVE-2013-6230	getPORT#	6.8	get_price()	The Winsock WSAIoctl API in Microsoft Windows Server 2008
column2: as used in ISC BIND 9.6-ESV before 9.6-ESV-R10-P1
column4: 9.9 before 9.9.4-P1
column8: does not properly support the SIO_GET_INTERFACE_LIST command for netmask 255.255.255.255
column9: which allows remote attackers to bypass intended IP address restrictions by leveraging misinterpretation of this netmask as a 0.0.0.0 netmask.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-6230

column1: CVE-2015-1349	getPORT#	5.4	get_price()	named in ISC BIND 9.7.0 through 9.9.6 before 9.9.6-P2 and 9.10.x before 9.10.1-P2
column2: when DNSSEC validation and the managed-keys feature are enabled
column3: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit
column4: or daemon crash) by triggering an incorrect trust-anchor management scenario in which no key is ready for use.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-1349

column1: CVE-2020-8617	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	Using a specially-crafted message
column2: an attacker may potentially cause a BIND server to reach an inconsistent state if the attacker knows (or successfully guesses) the name of a TSIG key used by the server. Since BIND
column4: configures a local session key even on servers whose configuration does not otherwise make use of it
column5: almost all current BIND servers are vulnerable. In releases of BIND dating from March 2018 and after
column6: an assertion check in tsig.c detects this inconsistent state and deliberately exits. Prior to the introduction of the check the server would continue operating in an inconsistent state

column1: CVE-2020-8616	getPORT#	8.6 HIGH	get_price()	A malicious actor who intentionally exploits this lack of effective limitation on the number of fetches performed when processing referrals can
column2: through the use of specially crafted referrals
column3: cause a recursing server to issue a very large number of fetches in an attempt to process the referral. This has at least two potential effects: The performance of the recursing server can potentially be degraded by the additional work required to perform these fetches
column4: and The attacker can exploit this behavior to use the recursing server as a reflector in a reflection attack with a high amplification factor.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-8616

column1: CVE-2020-12783	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	Exim through 4.93 has an out-of-bounds read in the SPA authenticator that could result in SPA/NTLM authentication bypass in auths/spa.c and auths/auth-spa.c.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-12783

CVE-2020-12783	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	Exim through 4.93 has an out-of-bounds read in the SPA authenticator that could result in SPA/NTLM authentication bypass in auths/spa.c and auths/auth-spa.c.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-12783

CVE-2020-12783	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	Exim through 4.93 has an out-of-bounds read in the SPA authenticator that could result in SPA/NTLM authentication bypass in auths/spa.c and auths/auth-spa.c.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-12783
CVE-2018-5740	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	"deny-answer-aliases" is a little-used feature intended to help recursive server operators protect end users against DNS rebinding attacks
column2: a potential method of circumventing the security model used by client browsers. However
column3: a defect in this feature makes it easy
column4: when the feature is in use
column5: to experience an assertion failure in name.c. Affects BIND 9.7.0->9.8.8

column1: CVE-2017-3145	getPORT#	7.5 HIGH	get_price()	BIND was improperly sequencing cleanup operations on upstream recursion fetch contexts
column2: leading in some cases to a use-after-free error that can trigger an assertion failure and crash in named. Affects BIND 9.0.0 to 9.8.x

CVE-2015-8000	getPORT#	5.0	get_price()	db.c in named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P2 and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (REQUIRE assertion failure and daemon exit) via a malformed class attribute.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8000

CVE-2017-3143	getPORT#	5.9 MEDIUM	get_price()	An attacker who is able to send and receive messages to an authoritative DNS server and who has knowledge of a valid TSIG key name for the zone and service being targeted may be able to manipulate BIND into accepting an unauthorized dynamic update. Affects BIND 9.4.0->9.8.8

CVE-2017-3142	getPORT#	3.7 LOW	get_price()	An attacker who is able to send and receive messages to an authoritative DNS server and who has knowledge of a valid TSIG key name may be able to circumvent TSIG authentication of AXFR requests via a carefully constructed request packet. A server that relies solely on TSIG keys for protection with no other ACL protection could be manipulated into: providing an AXFR of a zone to an unauthorized recipient or accepting bogus NOTIFY packets. Affects BIND 9.4.0->9.8.8

CVE-2017-3136	getPORT#	5.9 MEDIUM	get_price()	A query with a specific set of characteristics could cause a server using DNS64 to encounter an assertion failure and terminate. An attacker could deliberately construct a query
column2: enabling denial-of-service against a server if it was configured to use the DNS64 feature and other preconditions were met. Affects BIND 9.8.0 -> 9.8.8-P1

column1: CVE-2016-2775	getPORT#	5.9 MEDIUM	get_price()	ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.9-P2
column4: when lwresd or the named lwres option is enabled
column5: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a long request that uses the lightweight resolver protocol.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-2775

column1: CVE-2016-1285	getPORT#	6.8 MEDIUM	get_price()	named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.8-P4 and 9.10.x before 9.10.3-P4 does not properly handle DNAME records when parsing fetch reply messages
column2: which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via a malformed packet to the rndc (aka control channel) interface

column1: CVE-2020-8622	getPORT#	6.5 MEDIUM	get_price()	In BIND 9.0.0 -> 9.11.21
column4: also affects 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.21-S1 of the BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition
column5: An attacker on the network path for a TSIG-signed request
column6: or operating the server receiving the TSIG-signed request
column7: could send a truncated response to that request
column9: causing the server to exit. Alternately
column10: an off-path attacker would have to correctly guess when a TSIG-signed request was sent
column11: along with other characteristics of the packet and message
column12: and spoof a truncated response to trigger an assertion failure

column1: CVE-2016-6170	getPORT#	6.5 MEDIUM	get_price()	ISC BIND through 9.9.9-P1
column3: and 9.11.x through 9.11.0b1 allows primary DNS servers to cause a denial of service (secondary DNS server crash) via a large AXFR response
column4: and possibly allows IXFR servers to cause a denial of service (IXFR client crash) via a large IXFR response and allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (primary DNS server crash) via a large UPDATE message.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-6170

column1: CVE-2014-0591	getPORT#	2.6	get_price()	The query_findclosestnsec3 function in query.c in named in ISC BIND 9.6
column4: and 9.6-ESV before 9.6-ESV-R10-P2
column5: allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (INSIST assertion failure and daemon exit) via a crafted DNS query to an authoritative nameserver that uses the NSEC3 signing feature.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-0591

column1: CVE-2013-5661	getPORT#	5.9 MEDIUM	get_price()	Cache Poisoning issue exists in DNS Response Rate Limiting.	https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-5661
